content.text: The code repository located at /tmp/workdir/baseline_strands_restricted_shell_20260128/biomedicus-measures is currently written in Java 8. Please migrate the entire codebase to Java 17.

reasoningText.text:
I need to migrate a Java 8 project to Java 17. Let me start by exploring the repository structure to understand what we're working with.

Steps I should take:
1. First, explore the repository structure
2. Check the pom.xml file to see current Java version and dependencies
3. Update the Java version in pom.xml to 17
4. Update all dependencies to versions compatible with Java 17
5. Run mvn clean verify to check if everything works
6. Fix any issues that arise

Let's start!

  <description>
    A lightweight (small and dependency-free) Java 8 library for identifying and
    normalizing numbers and measurements in text. This was developed as a stand-alone component of
    BioMedICUS, a biomedical and clinical NLP engine developed by the NLP-IE Group at the University
    of Minnesota Institute for Health Informatics.
  </description>
  <url>https://github.com/nlpie/biomedicus-measures</url>

  <scm>

    </developerConnection>
    <url>https://github.com/nlpie/biomedicus-measures</url>
  </scm>
</project>

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<!--
  ~ Copyright (c) 2017 Regents of the University of Minnesota.
  ~
  ~ Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
  ~ you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
  ~ You may obtain a copy of the License at
  ~
  ~     http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
  ~
  ~ Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
  ~ distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
  ~ WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
  ~ See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
  ~ limitations under the License.
  -->

<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0"
  xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
  xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
  <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>

  <groupId>edu.umn.biomedicus</groupId>
  <artifactId>biomedicus-measures</artifactId>
  <version>2.0.3-SNAPSHOT</version>
  <packaging>jar</packaging>

  <name>BioMedICUS Measures</name>

  <description>
    A lightweight (small and dependency-free) Java 17 library for identifying and
    normalizing numbers and measurements in text. This was developed as a stand-alone component of
    BioMedICUS, a biomedical and clinical NLP engine developed by the NLP-IE Group at the University
    of Minnesota Institute for Health Informatics.
  </description>
  <url>https://github.com/nlpie/biomedicus-measures</url>

  <organization>
    <name>University of Minnesota Institute for Health Informatics NLP/IE Program</name>
    <url>http://www.bmhi.umn.edu/ihi/research/nlpie/index.htm</url>
  </organization>

  <licenses>
    <license>
      <name>Apache License, Version 2.0</name>
      <url>http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0.txt</url>
      <distribution>repo</distribution>
      <comments>A business-friendly OSS license</comments>
    </license>
  </licenses>

  <developers>
    <developer>
      <name>Ben Knoll</name>
      <email>benknoll@umn.edu</email>
      <organization>NLP/IE Group at the University of Minnesota Institute for Health Informatics</organization>
      <organizationUrl>http://www.bmhi.umn.edu/ihi/research/nlpie/index.htm</organizationUrl>
    </developer>
  </developers>

  <scm>
    <connection>scm:git:git://github.com:nlpie/biomedicus-measures.git</connection>
    <developerConnection>
      scm:git:ssh://github.com:nlpie/biomedicus-measures.git
    </developerConnection>
    <url>https://github.com/nlpie/biomedicus-measures</url>
  </scm>

  <properties>
    <java.version>17</java.version>
    <maven.compiler.source>17</maven.compiler.source>
    <maven.compiler.target>17</maven.compiler.target>
    <maven.compiler.release>17</maven.compiler.release>
    <project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding>
    <project.reporting.outputEncoding>UTF-8</project.reporting.outputEncoding>
  </properties>

  <dependencies>
    <!-- SLF4J API -->
    <dependency>
      <groupId>org.slf4j</groupId>
      <artifactId>slf4j-api</artifactId>
      <version>2.0.11</version>
    </dependency>

    <!-- JSR305 annotations (optional) -->
    <dependency>
      <groupId>com.google.code.findbugs</groupId>
      <artifactId>jsr305</artifactId>
      <version>3.0.2</version>
      <optional>true</optional>
    </dependency>

    <!-- Test dependencies -->
    <dependency>
      <groupId>org.junit.jupiter</groupId>
      <artifactId>junit-jupiter-engine</artifactId>
      <version>5.10.1</version>
      <scope>test</scope>
    </dependency>

    <dependency>
      <groupId>org.mockito</groupId>
      <artifactId>mockito-core</artifactId>
      <version>5.8.0</version>
      <scope>test</scope>
    </dependency>

    <dependency>
      <groupId>org.slf4j</groupId>
      <artifactId>slf4j-nop</artifactId>
      <version>2.0.11</version>
      <scope>test</scope>
    </dependency>
  </dependencies>

  <build>
    <plugins>
      <!-- Maven Compiler Plugin -->
      <plugin>
        <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
        <artifactId>maven-compiler-plugin</artifactId>
        <version>3.12.1</version>
        <configuration>
          <source>17</source>
          <target>17</target>
          <release>17</release>
        </configuration>
      </plugin>

      <!-- Maven Surefire Plugin for running tests -->
      <plugin>
        <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
        <artifactId>maven-surefire-plugin</artifactId>
        <version>3.2.5</version>
      </plugin>

      <!-- Maven JAR Plugin -->
      <plugin>
        <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
        <artifactId>maven-jar-plugin</artifactId>
        <version>3.3.0</version>
      </plugin>

      <!-- Maven Source Plugin -->
      <plugin>
        <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
        <artifactId>maven-source-plugin</artifactId>
        <version>3.3.0</version>
        <executions>
          <execution>
            <id>attach-sources</id>
            <goals>
              <goal>jar-no-fork</goal>
            </goals>
          </execution>
        </executions>
      </plugin>

      <!-- Maven Javadoc Plugin -->
      <plugin>
        <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
        <artifactId>maven-javadoc-plugin</artifactId>
        <version>3.6.3</version>
        <executions>
          <execution>
            <id>attach-javadocs</id>
            <goals>
              <goal>jar</goal>
            </goals>
          </execution>
        </executions>
      </plugin>
    </plugins>
  </build>

<!--

<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0"
  xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
  xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
  <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>

  <groupId>edu.umn.biomedicus</groupId>
  <artifactId>biomedicus-measures</artifactId>
  <version>2.0.3-SNAPSHOT</version>
  <packaging>jar</packaging>

  <name>BioMedICUS Measures</name>

  <description>
    A lightweight (small and dependency-free) Java 17 library for identifying and
    normalizing numbers and measurements in text. This was developed as a stand-alone component of
    BioMedICUS, a biomedical and clinical NLP engine developed by the NLP-IE Group at the University
    of Minnesota Institute for Health Informatics.
  </description>
  <url>https://github.com/nlpie/biomedicus-measures</url>

  <organization>
    <name>University of Minnesota Institute for Health Informatics NLP/IE Program</name>
    <url>http://www.bmhi.umn.edu/ihi/research/nlpie/index.htm</url>
  </organization>

  <licenses>
    <license>
      <name>Apache License, Version 2.0</name>
      <url>http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0.txt</url>
      <distribution>repo</distribution>
      <comments>A business-friendly OSS license</comments>
    </license>
  </licenses>

  <developers>
    <developer>
      <name>Ben Knoll</name>
      <email>benknoll@umn.edu</email>
      <organization>NLP/IE Group at the University of Minnesota Institute for Health Informatics</organization>
      <organizationUrl>http://www.bmhi.umn.edu/ihi/research/nlpie/index.htm</organizationUrl>
    </developer>
  </developers>

  <scm>
    <connection>scm:git:git://github.com:nlpie/biomedicus-measures.git</connection>
    <developerConnection>
      scm:git:ssh://github.com:nlpie/biomedicus-measures.git
    </developerConnection>
    <url>https://github.com/nlpie/biomedicus-measures</url>
  </scm>

  <properties>
    <java.version>17</java.version>
    <maven.compiler.source>17</maven.compiler.source>
    <maven.compiler.target>17</maven.compiler.target>
    <maven.compiler.release>17</maven.compiler.release>
    <project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding>
    <project.reporting.outputEncoding>UTF-8</project.reporting.outputEncoding>
  </properties>

  <dependencies>
    <!-- SLF4J API -->
    <dependency>
      <groupId>org.slf4j</groupId>
      <artifactId>slf4j-api</artifactId>
      <version>2.0.11</version>
    </dependency>

    <!-- JSR305 annotations (optional) -->
    <dependency>
      <groupId>com.google.code.findbugs</groupId>
      <artifactId>jsr305</artifactId>
      <version>3.0.2</version>
      <optional>true</optional>
    </dependency>

    <!-- Test dependencies -->
    <dependency>
      <groupId>org.junit.jupiter</groupId>
      <artifactId>junit-jupiter-engine</artifactId>
      <version>5.10.1</version>
      <scope>test</scope>
    </dependency>

    <dependency>
      <groupId>org.mockito</groupId>
      <artifactId>mockito-core</artifactId>
      <version>5.8.0</version>
      <scope>test</scope>
    </dependency>

    <dependency>
      <groupId>org.slf4j</groupId>
      <artifactId>slf4j-nop</artifactId>
      <version>2.0.11</version>
      <scope>test</scope>
    </dependency>
  </dependencies>

  <build>
    <plugins>
      <!-- Maven Compiler Plugin -->
      <plugin>
        <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
        <artifactId>maven-compiler-plugin</artifactId>
        <version>3.12.1</version>
        <configuration>
          <source>17</source>
          <target>17</target>
          <release>17</release>
        </configuration>
      </plugin>

      <!-- Maven Surefire Plugin for running tests -->
      <plugin>
        <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
        <artifactId>maven-surefire-plugin</artifactId>
        <version>3.2.5</version>
      </plugin>

      <!-- Maven JAR Plugin -->
      <plugin>
        <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
        <artifactId>maven-jar-plugin</artifactId>
        <version>3.3.0</version>
      </plugin>

      <!-- Maven Source Plugin -->
      <plugin>
        <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
        <artifactId>maven-source-plugin</artifactId>
        <version>3.3.0</version>
        <executions>
          <execution>
            <id>attach-sources</id>
            <goals>
              <goal>jar-no-fork</goal>
            </goals>
          </execution>
        </executions>
      </plugin>

      <!-- Maven Javadoc Plugin -->
      <plugin>
        <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
        <artifactId>maven-javadoc-plugin</artifactId>
        <version>3.6.3</version>
        <executions>
          <execution>
            <id>attach-javadocs</id>
            <goals>
              <goal>jar</goal>
            </goals>
          </execution>
        </executions>
      </plugin>
    </plugins>
  </build>

  <distributionManagement>
    <repository>
      <id>ossrh</id>
      <url>https://oss.sonatype.org/service/local/staging/deploy/maven2</url>
    </repository>
    <snapshotRepository>
      <id>ossrh</id>
      <url>https://oss.sonatype.org/content/repositories/snapshots</url>
    </snapshotRepository>
  </distributionManagement>
</project>

  <packaging>jar</packaging>

  <name>BioMedICUS Measures</name>

  <description>
    A lightweight (small and dependency-free) Java 17 library for identifying and
    normalizing numbers and measurements in text. This was developed as a stand-alone component of
    BioMedICUS, a biomedical and clinical NLP engine developed by the NLP-IE Group at the University
    of Minnesota Institute for Health Informatics.
  </description>
  <url>https://github.com/nlpie/biomedicus-measures</url>

  </organization>

      <url>http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0.txt</url>
      <distribution>repo</distribution>

    </license>
  </licenses>

  <developers>

      <name>Ben Knoll</name>
      <email>benknoll@umn.edu</email>
      <organization>NLP/IE Group at the University of Minnesota Institute for Health Informatics</organization>
      <organizationUrl>http://www.bmhi.umn.edu/ihi/research/nlpie/index.htm</organizationUrl>
    </developer>
  </developers>

  <scm>
    <connection>scm:git:git://github.com:nlpie/biomedicus-measures.git</connection>
    <developerConnection>
      scm:git:ssh://github.com:nlpie/biomedicus-measures.git
    </developerConnection>

  </scm>

  <properties>
    <java.version>17</java.version>
    <maven.compiler.source>17</maven.compiler.source>
    <maven.compiler.target>17</maven.compiler.target>
    <maven.compiler.release>17</maven.compiler.release>
    <project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding>
    <project.reporting.outputEncoding>UTF-8</project.reporting.outputEncoding>
  </properties>

  <dependencies>
    <!-- SLF4J API -->
    <dependency>
      <groupId>org.slf4j</groupId>
      <artifactId>slf4j-api</artifactId>
      <version>2.0.11</version>
    </dependency>

    <!-- JSR305 annotations (optional) -->
    <dependency>

    </dependency>

  <build>

      <plugin>
        <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
        <artifactId>maven-compiler-plugin</artifactId>
        <version>3.12.1</version>
        <configuration>

          <target>17</target>

## Migration Date
January 29, 2026

## Changes Made

### 1. POM.xml Updates

#### Removed Parent POM Dependency

#### Java Version Updates

- Updated properties:

#### Dependency Updates

| Dependency | Old Version | New Version |
|------------|-------------|-------------|
| slf4j-api | 1.7.25 | 2.0.11 |
| slf4j-nop | 1.7.25 | 2.0.11 |
| jsr305 | 3.0.2 | 3.0.2 (unchanged) |
| junit-jupiter-engine | 5.3.2 | 5.10.1 |
| mockito-core | 2.23.4 | 5.8.0 |

#### Maven Plugin Updates
All Maven plugins updated to latest versions:

| Plugin | Old Version | New Version |
|--------|-------------|-------------|
| maven-compiler-plugin | 3.8.0 | 3.12.1 |
| maven-surefire-plugin | 2.22.1 | 3.2.5 |
| maven-jar-plugin | 3.1.1 | 3.3.0 |
| maven-source-plugin | (new) | 3.3.0 |
| maven-javadoc-plugin | 3.0.1 | 3.6.3 |

### 2. Build Configuration
- Added explicit `<packaging>jar</packaging>`
- Added `<groupId>edu.umn.biomedicus</groupId>` (previously inherited)
- Maintained all metadata (organization, licenses, developers, SCM)

- All existing tests (37 tests across 4 test classes) pass without modification

✅ `mvn clean verify` - SUCCESS

### Test Results
✅ All 37 tests passed:
- DecimalNumberAcceptorTest: 6 tests
- FractionNumberAcceptorTest: 8 tests
- EnglishNumeralsAcceptorTest: 22 tests
- UnitRecognizerTest: 1 test

### Bytecode Version
✅ Compiled classes have major version 61 (Java 17)

## Compatibility Notes

1. **SLF4J 2.x**: The upgrade from SLF4J 1.7.x to 2.0.x is backward compatible at the API level
2. **JUnit 5**: Already using JUnit Jupiter, only version bump required
3. **Mockito 5**: Fully compatible with Java 17 and JUnit 5
4. **No Breaking Changes**: All existing code works without modification

## Benefits of Java 17 Migration

1. Long-term support (LTS) version with extended support lifecycle
2. Performance improvements
3. Enhanced language features (sealed classes, pattern matching, text blocks, etc.)
4. Better garbage collection options
5. Security updates and bug fixes
6. Access to modern Java ecosystem and tooling

## Backward Compatibility

The generated JAR requires Java 17 or higher to run. Applications using this library will need to migrate to Java 17+.

# Java 8 to Java 17 Migration Summary

## Migration Date
January 29, 2026

## Changes Made

### 1. POM.xml Updates

#### Removed Parent POM Dependency
- Removed dependency on `biomedicus-base-jdk8` parent POM (version 1.4)
- Created a standalone POM configuration

#### Java Version Updates
- Changed Java version from 1.8 to 17
- Updated properties:
  - `java.version`: 1.8 → 17
  - `maven.compiler.source`: 1.8 → 17
  - `maven.compiler.target`: 1.8 → 17
  - Added `maven.compiler.release`: 17

#### Dependency Updates
All dependencies updated to Java 17 compatible versions:

| Dependency | Old Version | New Version |
|------------|-------------|-------------|
| slf4j-api | 1.7.25 | 2.0.11 |
| slf4j-nop | 1.7.25 | 2.0.11 |
| jsr305 | 3.0.2 | 3.0.2 (unchanged) |
| junit-jupiter-engine | 5.3.2 | 5.10.1 |
| mockito-core | 2.23.4 | 5.8.0 |

#### Maven Plugin Updates
All Maven plugins updated to latest versions:

| Plugin | Old Version | New Version |
|--------|-------------|-------------|
| maven-compiler-plugin | 3.8.0 | 3.12.1 |
| maven-surefire-plugin | 2.22.1 | 3.2.5 |
| maven-jar-plugin | 3.1.1 | 3.3.0 |
| maven-source-plugin | (new) | 3.3.0 |
| maven-javadoc-plugin | 3.0.1 | 3.6.3 |

### 2. Build Configuration
- Added explicit `<packaging>jar</packaging>`
- Added `<groupId>edu.umn.biomedicus</groupId>` (previously inherited)
- Maintained all metadata (organization, licenses, developers, SCM)
- Kept distribution management configuration for OSSRH

### 3. Source Code
- No source code changes required
- All 19 Java source files compile successfully with Java 17
- All existing tests (37 tests across 4 test classes) pass without modification

## Verification Results

### Build Status
✅ `mvn clean verify` - SUCCESS

### Test Results
✅ All 37 tests passed:
- DecimalNumberAcceptorTest: 6 tests
- FractionNumberAcceptorTest: 8 tests
- EnglishNumeralsAcceptorTest: 22 tests
- UnitRecognizerTest: 1 test

### Bytecode Version
✅ Compiled classes have major version 61 (Java 17)

## Compatibility Notes

1. **SLF4J 2.x**: The upgrade from SLF4J 1.7.x to 2.0.x is backward compatible at the API level
2. **JUnit 5**: Already using JUnit Jupiter, only version bump required
3. **Mockito 5**: Fully compatible with Java 17 and JUnit 5
4. **No Breaking Changes**: All existing code works without modification

## Benefits of Java 17 Migration

1. Long-term support (LTS) version with extended support lifecycle
2. Performance improvements
3. Enhanced language features (sealed classes, pattern matching, text blocks, etc.)
4. Better garbage collection options
5. Security updates and bug fixes
6. Access to modern Java ecosystem and tooling

## Backward Compatibility

The generated JAR requires Java 17 or higher to run. Applications using this library will need to migrate to Java 17+.
